articles.title: Soybeans open down 8¢ | Tuesday, February 14, 2023
articles.description: Spotting rain in Argentina leading to more stress on crops.
articles.content:
At the open, corn is up 1⁄ 4 of a penny while soybeans are down 8¢.
CBOT wheat is down 4¢. KC wheat is down 2¢. Minneapolis wheat is down a penny.

articles.title: Argentina announces price controls to bring down cost of popular beef cuts
articles.description: Argentina's economy ministry announced on Monday a price control program to bring down the cost of popular beef cuts amid ongoing high inflation. During a press conference, an economy ministry official said some popular cuts of meat would see prices drop around 30%.
articles.content:
Argentina's economy ministry announced on Monday a price control program to bring down the cost of popular beef cuts amid ongoing high inflation.

articles.title: Argentina says mafia groups are spurring Russian birth tourism
articles.description: Argentina says mafia groups are spurring Russian birth tourism
articles.content:
Argentine officials have blamed organised "mafias" for promoting birth tourism to the South American country by Russian mothers-to-be amid a boom in numbers travelling there since the invasion of Ukraine looking to get their children citizenship.

articles.title: Precipitation needed to curb crop losses in Argentina
articles.description: Challenging weather continued into the start of February for Argentina and southern Brazil with hotter and drier conditions.
articles.content: The weather in Argentina continued to be challenging for crop production in early February 2023. The first full week of February, week-ending Feb. 11, was one of the driest and the fourth hottest in 30+ years for Argentina’s major soybean production ... [2316 chars]

articles.title: 30 pregnant Russian women arrive in Argentina on single plane amid passport scramble over Ukraine war
articles.description: More than 30 pregnant Russian women arrived in Buenos Aires on a single international flight on Thursday evening, the latest among thousands of mothers-to-be fleeing the effects of the war in Ukraine and seeking out stronger passports in Argentina.
articles.content:
